text: AWS has enabled the New York Public
Library to deploy applications in record
time what used to take us months or
years to build out we can now do in a
fraction of that time I'm Jay Hawk I'm
director of development operations or
devops and Enterprise Computing at the
New York Public Library the New York
Public Library is a library system in
three buus of New York City we service
millions of patrons every single year
before the cloud we had a very fractured
it environment essentially we had older
technology in many places we had leg
Computing and we had a lot of difficulty
with essentially scaling our systems um
we also didn't have a lot of Standards
or standardization across our
environment and uh we realized at some
point that this was just not a scalable
solution for us we started looking at a
project to essentially um revamp that
web infrastructure that web platform how
do we modernize this platform as we did
this project we realized that the cost
of doing it was going to be substantial
it's easily going to be in the millions
of dollars so we looked at AWS and that
helped us essentially realize very
quickly that WS changed the entire ball
game we started running infrastructure
as code and that let us build scalable
repeatable systems very quickly very
easily we also gain redundancies and
resiliencies that we would not have
otherwise had they were just too cost
prohibitive and we have this entire
security infrastructure from AWS that
just comes as a standard in the service
our primary website is hosted on AWS our
digital collections website we just want
a fantastic award the best practice
award in the city on a cloud Innovation
Challenge runs in AWS to provide
over 700,000 images maps books things of
that nature to the public for free they
got significant press coverage it was
the New York Times Washington Post we
got a significant amount of traffic from
that press and years ago it would have
been very hard for us essentially deal
with that load we probably would not
have been able to but with AWS in a few
minutes we're able to scale our
environment to twice as big three times
as big and then we're able to scale it
back down as demand died down and we
built this all in in Amazon's uh web
services using things like ec2 elastic
load balancing RDS Services Auto scaling
things of that nature and then we'
wrapped around to traditional devops
type of Technologies so where we used to
deploy code on a Sunday night many years
ago and spend a cumulative eight hours
on it we now do it in within 20 minutes
so we cut that time by 95% well hws has
made my job a lot a lot easier um in the
old days of the old traditional model we
not only had to engineer something we
had to sometimes over engineer something
today if we have an idea and we want to
do something we can essentially
prototype it we can build it in no time
we can get a proof of concept we can
sort of model our pricing and if we're
wrong if it's not the right size or
anything we can just turn it off right
we can start all over and or we can go
the other way and scale it up so that's
made my job considerably easier
[Music]
